questions.question: The school ……………………… in September.
questions.description: The simple present is sometimes used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: I will call the police if you ……………………. at once.
questions.description: The simple present is often used in subordinate clauses with a future meaning.

questions.question: ……………………. we report this?
questions.description: Shall is used when asking for instructions.

questions.question: ……………………….. you help me with the homework?
questions.description: Will is used in requests for help.

questions.question: The train ……………………… at
questions.description: The simple present is sometimes used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: By next January, I ……………………….. for fifteen years.
questions.description: The future perfect continuous is used to say that something will have been completed by a certain time in the future.

questions.question: I promise I ……………………….. you my money back.
Let’s go somewhere quiet, …………………………. we?
questions.description: We use shall in question tags after let’s.

questions.question: You ……………………… never …………………….. me with anything.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used with the expressions ever, never, already etc.

questions.question: I ………………………… with a minor accident yesterday.
questions.description: The simple past is the most normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: He …………………….. all his life in his native village.
